page.title: 10Pitlessie Mill Farm
page.content: Pitlessie Mill is just north of the village of Pitlessie and lies on the village side of the river. It is an{old mill}that is still {working today.}It has been used to {grind grain}for many years.In those days all the local farmers would take their grain to the mill for grinding and then sell it.After a time a farm was built next to the mill which is now worked by the{Smith family. At present the mill has been converted into a place where the{grain is stored {and dried}after it has been harvested. After that the bulk of the grain goes to the distilleries for use in the making of whisky. Some grain is kept for{animal feed. So as you can see Pitlessie Mill has been at work with grain for centuries.{
